snippet: Educators question whether new classes can help students meet literacy rules that could force them to stay back a year in school.
abstract: Educators in North Carolina are questioning whether new summer classes will help third-grade students meet literacy rules that could force them to stay back a year in school; about 1,500 of the 1,900 students in Charlotte who failed standardized reading test given to all third-graders in the spring enrolled in literacy school in June; some critics argue that efforts need to begin much earlier in a child's life.
lead_paragraph: Educators question whether new classes can help students meet literacy rules that could force them to stay back a year in school.
